title: Topological filtering of a signal over a network
authors:
Matias de Jong van Lier, Sebasti\'an El\'ias Graiff Zurita, Shizuo
  Kaji
abstract:
Graph Signal Processing deals with the problem of analyzing and processing
signals defined on graphs. In this paper, we introduce a novel filtering method
for graph-based signals by employing ideas from topological data analysis. We
begin by working with signals over general graphs and then extend our approach
to what we term signals over graphs with faces. To construct the filter, we
introduce a new structure called the Basin Hierarchy Tree, which encodes the
persistent homology. We provide an efficient algorithm and demonstrate the
effectiveness of our approach through examples with synthetic and real
datasets. This work bridges topological data analysis and signal processing,
presenting a new application of persistent homology as a topological data
processing tool.
subjects: Electrical Engineering and Systems Science/Signal Processing
